flavor: Nobody told you it all ripens at once! You hope people like corn.
effect: Add 1d6 to your community's resource rolls.

flavor: It felt medieval when you started, but you owe your life to those bricks.
effect: If an event card would cause you to lose resources or disband the community, instead destroy this card.

flavor: Don't let them forget what we lost.
effect: You may subtract 1d6 from the cost of your first Civilization Point purchased each round.

flavor: Not sure a bag of bandages and tylenol makes you a doctor, but it's something.
effect: If you purchase 2 Civilization Points in one round, you get a third for free.

flavor: Never thought you'd get to lumberjacking in the apocalypse.
effect: Community maintenance costs are reduced by 1d2 (minimum 1).

flavor: This is a lot harder than it looks, and it looks hard.
effect: Community maintenance costs are reduced by 1d2 (minimum 1).

flavor: Strange. The Militia is somehow less violent than the alternatives.
effect: If your community disbands, resources are distributed evenly among across members (rounding up).

flavor: You start to feel human again when you're in this place.
effect: New members may join your community, and you may invite other communities to join yours. If an event card would cause you to remove a member, instead destroy this card.

flavor: You can't go backwards. The only way forward is with your eyes open.
effect: You may pay the cost of a Civilization Point to instead decrease the Extinction Counter by 1.

flavor: Not everybody believes, but nobody laughs at it anymore.
effect: You may purchase or exchange individual traits for community members for 5 resources each.
